docs.lead_paragraph: ART and medicine are not necessarily strange gurney-fellows. Although some people might find it peculiar to visit a hospital to see a serious art exhibition that is not directly health-related, the Pavilion Galleries at the Virtua Health-Memorial Hospital Burlington County here have been showing art for almost two decades. Bette Johnson of Medford and Pat Stefanini of Moorestown founded the gallery program in 1980 with a startup grant from the New Jersey State Council on the Arts. ''Fine arts galleries were established for holistic healing,'' Ms. Johnson fondly recalled in a recent interview. In 1997, the main gallery of the 369-bed hospital was completely renovated, with a new hanging system and track lighting, so that exhibitions could be installed more professionally.

headline.main: Sensibilities of Childhood Without the Sentimentality
